required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Autologous Bone Marrow Mononuclear Cells in the Combined Treatment of Coronary Heart Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Influence of the Administration of Autologous Bone Marrow Mononuclear Cells for the Duration of Functioning Aorto-coronary Bypass Grafts in the Surgical Treatment of Coronary Heart Disease

lead_sponsor.agency: St. Petersburg State Pavlov Medical University

clinical_study.source: St. Petersburg State Pavlov Medical University

oversight_info.authority: Russia: Ministry of Health of the Russian Federation

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study evaluate the effect of the method of administration of autologous bone marrow mononuclear cells for the duration of of functioning aorto-coronary bypass grafts in the surgical treatment of coronary heart disease, to assess the degree of effectiveness depending on the method of transplantation (intramyocardial, Intracoronary).

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: All-cause mortality associated with the progression of basic disease

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of functioning grafts in patients with implantation of autologous bone marrow mononuclear cells.

arm_group.description: intramyocardial administration of autologous bone marrow mononuclear cells during the operation coronary artery bypass grafting
intramyocardial administration of 0.9 % NaCl (sodium chloride) 0.2 ml
intramyocardial and intracoronary administration of autologous bone marrow mononuclear cells during coronary artery bypass grafting

intervention.intervention_name: coronary artery bypass grafting with administration of autologous bone marrow stem cells

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Men and women from 18 to 80 years
- Patients with angina pectoris III-IV functional class
- Patients signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Intolerance of heparin and HES (hydroxyethyl starch)
- Hypothyroidism and hyperthyroidism.
- Associated pathology with a projected lifespan limitation to 3 years.
- infection diseases
- Simultaneous participation in another study.
- Pregnancy.
- Severe mental disorder.
- Refusal of a patient to participate in the study.

overall_official.affiliation: First Pavlov State Medical University of St. Petersburg.

facility.name: First Pavlov State Medical University of St. Petersburg
